meanings.sent1: The rasping noise of the old door hinges made me cringe.
meanings.sent2: The cat's rasping meow woke up the entire household.
meanings.sent3: The rasping sound of the chalk on the blackboard was like nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent4: The rasping wind against the window sounded like a ghost whispering.
meanings.sent5: The rasping cough echoed through the quiet room, startling everyone.

meanings.definition: To scrape or rub with a rough, grating sound
meanings.sent1: She was rasping the sandpaper against the rough wood to smooth it out.
meanings.sent2: The chef rasped the lemon zest to add a burst of flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The old man rasped the metal against the stone, creating sparks.
meanings.sent4: The saw rasped against the tree trunk, cutting through it slowly.
meanings.sent5: The rake rasped against the pavement as she cleared the leaves from the sidewalk.

meanings.sent1: The rasping of the chains against the metal bars filled the dungeon.
meanings.sent2: The constant rasping of the cicadas in the trees created a soothing background noise.
meanings.sent3: The rasping of the old record player added a nostalgic touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: The rasping of the car brakes made everyone turn their heads in alarm.
meanings.sent5: The rasping of the wind through the branches sounded like a distant storm approaching.
